Swing Dancing at Arnold's Lounge
"Cut a rug" in a fun, inclusive environment for all skill levels.
Every Tuesday | 7:30 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.
Swing Dancing at Arnold's Lounge
3912 N. Ponce De Leon Blvd.
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
Learn some new moves during swing dancing lessons at Arnold's Lounge every Tuesday from 7:30 to 8:15 p.m. All skill levels are welcome to join the party, and no partner is necessary to participate.
The St. Augustine Rug Cutters host swing and jive lessons, with passionate and talented instructors present to help guide novice and experienced dancers. New styles are introduced every six weeks including the shag, jitterbug, jive, Lindy Hop, and East Coast/West Coast swing.
Keep the fun going after the lesson during the open dance session until 10:00 p.m.
Admission:
$10.00 per person. The open dance is free.
When:
Every Tuesday from 7:30 to 10:00 p.m. The dance class is from 7:30 to 8:15 p.m., followed by an open dance from 8:15 to 10:00 p.m.
Where:
Arnold's Lounge
is located at 3912 North Ponce De Leon Boulevard, St. Augustine, Florida 32084.

Fall Members Art Show
Annual exhibit showcasing local and regional artists.
Tuesdays - Sundays, Sep. 5 - 28, 2025 | 12:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Fall Members Art Show
(904) 824-2310
At the corner of Cadiz & Marine.
22 Marine Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
+1 more
The St. Augustine Art Association presents the annual Fall Members Show beginning on Friday, September 5, 2025, and running until Sunday, September 28, 2025. This juried exhibit presents the works of St. Augustine Art Association members, welcoming all subjects and media such as oil on canvas, sculpture, and fiber-work. Visitors delight in the diverse range of expressive artwork from local and regional artists. The exhibit is also available for online viewing throughout the month.
A panel of independent jurors handpicks exceptional artists and awards monetary prizes, including the prestigious "Jean Wagner Troemel Best of Show" award. Much of the artwork is available for purchase, and proceeds support the artists and the art programs at the St. Augustine Art Association, an esteemed non-profit arts organization founded in 1924.
Admission:
Free
When:
The exhibit will open on Friday, September 5, 2025, during
First Friday Art Walk
and will remain on display through Sunday, September 28, 2025. Gallery hours are 12:00 to 4:00 p.m. Tuesday through Sunday. The gallery is closed on Mondays.
Where:
The
St. Augustine Art Association
is located at 22 Marine St. in downtown St. Augustine, Florida 32084.
Fall Members Art Show
(904) 824-2310
At the corner of Cadiz & Marine.
22 Marine Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084

Historical Events
History is the backbone of St. Augustine and is ever present in many of the local events. Living history takes visitors back in time to imagine what life was like in the colonial days of St. Augustine. Historic re-enactments take place often to re-create the significant events in St. Augustine’s past. Annual re-enactments like the Founder’s Day event in St. Augustine or the Spanish Colonial Grand Muster both commemorate notable events during the Spanish colonial period. It is the history in St. Augustine that ties each visitor and resident together and is common in all of us since St. Augustine’s successful port helped shape the country.

All St. Augustine Events
The Oldest City is known for its unique and plentiful events.
As the longest European-occupied settlement in the United States, St. Augustine is recognized as the nation’s oldest city and the host of many major events. St. Augustine's annual celebrations reflect this rich heritage and culture, where visitors and locals convene on historic downtown's brick streets. Our
Calendar of Events
lists all the gathering—big and small—whether they're at the beach, downtown, or on the river. There are historic reenactments, festivals and fairs, live concerts, and pirate parties, too. There's so many events to experience in St. Augustine that locals say, "it's a small town with a
big
calendar."

Sandra FitzSimmons Presents "Native Flora, Fauna, and Fantasy"
Celebrating the natural beauty of the Florida coast through artwork.
Friday, Aug. 1, 2025 - Thursday, Oct. 2, 2025 | 10:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Sandra FitzSimmons Presents "Native Flora, Fauna, and Fantasy"
(904) 280-0614
6000B Sawgrass Village Cir.
Ponte Vedra Beach, FL 32082
View Google Map
Share This
First Coast Cultural Center
(FCCC) presents
Native Flora, Fauna, and Fantasy
by Sandra FitzSimmons, from Friday, August 1 to Thursday, October 2, 2025, from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. An opening reception is August 1 from 5:30 to 7:00 p.m.
Ponte Vedra's local artist, Sandra FitzSimmons, showcases a collection of canvases and spinning wooden cubes inspired by her upbringing in the Low Country. The artist's work reflects her childhood experiences in nature as an active observer of animals. Centered on natural world themes, her pieces explore the diversity of Florida destinations such as Key West and the Panhandle.
Admission:
Free
When:
Opening is on Friday, August 1, 2025, from 5:30 to 7:00 p.m., with the exhibit extending until Thursday, October 2, 2025. Business hours are from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
Where:
First Coast Cultural Center, 6000B Sawgrass Village Circle, Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida 32082
Sandra FitzSimmons Presents "Native Flora, Fauna, and Fantasy"
(904) 280-0614
6000B Sawgrass Village Cir.
Ponte Vedra Beach, FL 32082

Guided Exploration Hike
Guests explore the flora and fauna of the Guana Peninsula.
First Saturday of the Month | 9:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m.
Guided Exploration Hike
(904) 380-8600
505 Guana River Road
Ponte Vedra Beach, FL 32082
View Google Map
Share This
The Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve (GTMNERR) invites visitors to explore the natural beauty and biodiversity of the Guana Peninsula during a guided hike held on the first Saturday of each month from 9:00 to 11:00 a.m. This informative hike offers a deep dive into the peninsula’s 5,000 years of human history, including how native peoples utilized estuarine resources and the ongoing efforts to preserve these vital ecosystems.
Participants should meet at the GTM Research Reserve’s Trailhead Pavilion, located west of the Guana Dam. Hikers are advised to wear comfortable closed-toe shoes for the hike. The hike is a free event but a $3.00 per vehicle parking fee applies.
For more information please
email Abigail Kuhn
.
Admission:
Free with a $3.00 per vehicle parking fee. Registration for this event is required, so
register now
to reserve your spot.
When:
The first Saturday of every month, from 9:00 to 11:00 a.m.
Where:
Meet at the GTM Research Reserve’s Trailhead Pavilion, located west of the Guana Dam at 505 Guana River Road, Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida 32082.
About GTMNERR:
The Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve
is a protected stretch of land consisting of wetlands and estuaries on Florida's East Coast that actively works to maintain and help preserve the natural landscape of Florida. The GTMNERR's volunteers and employees are dedicated to the preservation of an unspoiled and undeveloped natural treasure, supporting a vibrant ecosystem and subsystems.
Guided Exploration Hike
(904) 380-8600
505 Guana River Road
Ponte Vedra Beach, FL 32082

Nature Journaling at GTM Research Reserve
Connect with nature through journaling at the GTM Research Reserve.
First Thursday of the Month | 10:00 a.m. - noon
Nature Journaling at GTM Research Reserve
(904) 380-8600
505 Guana River Rd.
Ponte Vedra Beach, FL 32082
View Google Map
Share This
The Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve (GTMNERR) invites you to join nature journaling instructor, Elaine Bergstrom, on the first Thursday of every month, from 10:00 a.m. to noon, to explore the wonders of the reserve. This monthly event offers you the opportunity to connect with nature through the art of journaling, using words, pictures, and numbers to capture and learn more about the environment around you. Each session focuses on a different topic, providing new insights and experiences.
Meet at the Trailhead Pavilion picnic tables and wear appropriate outdoor clothing, dress in layers, and prepare for any weather. Bring a reusable water bottle, hat, insect repellent, sunscreen, and binoculars. Dogs are welcome, provided they remain on a leash and you clean up after them.
After the event, participants can explore the six hiking trails at the GTM Trailhead Pavilion or visit the GTM Visitor Center, which is open from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
Admission:
The event is free, but a $3.00 parking fee per vehicle applies if you park at Guana Dam.
Reserve your spot
.

The first Thursday of every month from 10:00 a.m. to noon.
Where:
Trailhead Pavilion picnic tables, GTM Research Reserve, 505 Guana River Road, Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida 32082
About GTMNERR:
The Guana Tolomato Matanzas National Estuarine Research Reserve

Dark of the Moon Ghost Tour
Armed only with glowsticks, guides tell tales of history and ghosts.
Select Dark Nights | Times Vary
View Website
(904) 829-0745
Dark of the Moon Ghost Tour
(904) 829-0745
St. Augustine Lighthouse
100 Red Cox Road
St. Augustine, FL 32080
View Google Map
Share This
Well after dark, during certain phases of the moon, the St. Augustine Lighthouse opens for a special history and ghost tour featuring true stories about the people who lived, visited, and worked at the lighthouse.
The tales also include information about those who died on the grounds and the ghostly encounters that have happened. This is the only regular tour that welcomes you into the lighthouse grounds at night and includes a climb to the top. Along the way, the guide shares the lighthouse's history, relating true tales of a ghostly presence.
Warning, in addition to being spooky, these tours are popular — you are strongly encouraged to book the tour while trip planning, before arriving in town.
USA Today
readers have voted the St. Augustine Lighthouse as one of the top 10 best haunted destinations in the United States.
Admission:
$29.95 for all adults and youth, including seniors. $24.95 for children ages seven to 12. Children must be at least seven years old and at least 44 inches tall. They must be able to climb the lighthouse stairs on their own.
When:
The days and times change with the seasons. In the winter, tours are generally available Fridays - Sundays, with at least one 90-minute tour each evening. Tours may start as early as 7:30 and the last tour could start as late as 10:45. Check their calendar
for exact times and availability, and to purchase tickets.
Schedule for Planning:
In June and July, the tours are offered at 8:30 p.m. on Wednesdays through Sundays. There is no Dark of the Moon Tour on July 4.
During other months, the tours are offered on Fridays through Sundays, with the first tour starting as early as 7:30 p.m. on some days, and with the last tour starting as late as 10:15 p.m. on other days.
There is usually a Dark of the Moon Tour on Halloween, regardless of the day of the week.
In the winter, tours are held on Fridays through Sundays, with extra tours on some school vacation weeks, including the week between Christmas and New Year's Eve.
Where:
At the St. Augustine Lighthouse, 100 Red Cox Road, St. Augustine, Florida 32080
Important Information:
The dates and times are updated seasonally. Factors include the phase of the moon, daylight saving time, and sunset. Please use
this link to see when the tour is running and to book tickets.

St. Augustine Lighthouse
100 Red Cox Road
St. Augustine, FL 32080

Presented by the music department of the
Cathedral Basilica of St. Augustine
, the First Friday Art Walk Concert Series coincides with St. Augustine's
First Friday Art Walk
. The concert takes place from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m. on the First Friday of each month at the Cathedral Basilica.
The organ recital is free and open to the public. Donations are accepted.
Occasionally, the concert will host various artists and musicians for the First Friday concert.

First Friday Garden Walk at Washington Oaks
Join park rangers and explore the history and beauty of Washington Oaks.
First Friday of the Month | 10:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m.
First Friday Garden Walk at Washington Oaks
(386) 446-6783
Two miles south of Marineland off A1A South.
6400 N Oceanshore Blvd.
Palm Coast, FL 32137
View Google Map
Share This
Show all
Washington Oaks Gardens State Park
hosts a special Garden Walk on the first Friday of each month, beginning at 10:00 a.m. A park ranger leads the 45-minute walk and introduces guests to the history and variety of this unique state park's beautiful formal gardens nestled within the maritime hammock.
Washington Oaks is 425 acres of coastal preserve that ranges from rare coquina rock formations along the Atlantic to the tidal marshes of the Matanzas River and the historic formal gardens within the live oaks, magnolias, and coastal scrub of the beachside hammock.
Events like the Garden Walk are offered by the Friends of Washington Oaks Gardens State Park, a community-based not-for-profit organization whose mission is to preserve, protect, promote, and provide interpretation at two state parks: Washington Oaks Gardens and
Faver-Dykes
.
Admission:
Regular park entrance fees apply—$5.00 per vehicle (two to eight people), $4.00 for single occupants, and $2.00 for pedestrians, bicyclists, and extra passengers.
When:

First Friday Garden Walk at Washington Oaks
Join park rangers and explore the history and beauty of Washington Oaks.
First Friday of the Month | 10:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m.
First Friday Garden Walk at Washington Oaks
(386) 446-6783
Two miles south of Marineland off A1A South.
6400 N Oceanshore Blvd.
Palm Coast, FL 32137
View Google Map
Share This
Show all
Washington Oaks Gardens State Park
hosts a special Garden Walk on the first Friday of each month, beginning at 10:00 a.m. A park ranger leads the 45-minute walk and introduces guests to the history and variety of this unique state park's beautiful formal gardens nestled within the maritime hammock.
Washington Oaks is 425 acres of coastal preserve that ranges from rare coquina rock formations along the Atlantic to the tidal marshes of the Matanzas River and the historic formal gardens within the live oaks, magnolias, and coastal scrub of the beachside hammock.
Events like the Garden Walk are offered by the Friends of Washington Oaks Gardens State Park, a community-based not-for-profit organization whose mission is to preserve, protect, promote, and provide interpretation at two state parks: Washington Oaks Gardens and
Faver-Dykes
.
Admission:
Regular park entrance fees apply—$5.00 per vehicle (two to eight people), $4.00 for single occupants, and $2.00 for pedestrians, bicyclists, and extra passengers.
When:
From
10:00 to 11:00 a.m. on the first Friday of each month.
Where:
Washington Oaks Gardens State Park, 6400 N. Oceanshore Blvd., Palm Coast, Florida 32137
Call (386) 446-6783 to reconfirm. For more information,
visit here
.

Event Venues
Celebrate a special event in a local venue of your choosing.
Most of St. Augustine's
hotels
have meeting rooms as do many of the restaurants. There are also fish camps, state or county
park
pavilions, studios, theatres, and even a miniature golf course party area. Many private local clubs, such as the
St. Augustine Yacht Club
, rent space and provide chairs, tables, and even meals. Some venues allow guests to hire their own
caterer
, bring their own food, or even rent a
food truck
or three to feed the crowd. In addition to traditional
wedding
and event spaces, St. Augustine offers fun and funky out-of-the-box spaces too.

Founders Day Plein Air Paint Out
See how artists transform a blank canvas into a finished landscape.
Friday - Monday, Sep. 5 - 8, 2025 | Times Vary
Founders Day Plein Air Paint Out
(904) 824-2310
This event takes place at various locations throughout town.
Share This
The St. Augustine Art Association hosts the Founder's Day Plein Air Paint Out from Friday, September 5, 2025, to Monday, September 9, 2025, at various locations throughout town.
This free event invites artists to paint en plein air around St. Augustine on Founder's Day weekend. This practice, a French term meaning "in the open air," involves artists painting outdoors directly from the landscape. Artists must be registered and must check in to paint. You can enjoy watching artists throughout town while you're out exploring.
Admission:
Free (Artists must
register online
by September 4, 2025.)
When:
Sunday, September 14, 2025, from 12:00 to 5:00 p.m.
Where:
Various locations throughout town.
About STAAA:
St. Augustine Art Association
serves as a central hub for art exhibitions, education, and community involvement, committed to fostering artistic excellence and honoring the rich cultural heritage of St. Johns County.
For Artists:
Artists must register online.
Find more information.
Painting Locations:
Artists may paint anywhere deemed legal by the city of St. Augustine, as detailed here
. They may also paint at the following locations:
Father Miguel O’Reilly House
garden (on select days, sign-up will be required) and on the exterior grounds of the
Castillo de San Marcos
.
Founders Day Plein Air Paint Out
(904) 824-2310
This event takes place at various locations throughout town.

Seasonal Events
Celebrate the season with festive events throughout the year.
Celebrate wintertime by taking the family on a holiday-themed tour of the
Nights of Lights
, meeting Santa Claus, and ringing in the New Year with
Fireworks on the Beach
. In the
spring
, enjoy the Cathedral Festival, Old Town Arts and Crafts Show, and the Easter parade. Summer in St. Augustine offers fewer active events, more time
on the beach
, and a chance to visit our attractions. Watch as fireworks light up the summer sky on the
4th of July
. And don't forget fall—the spookiest season around, thanks to Halloween and all the
ghosts
that live here. The city celebrates every season in style, so there's always something fresh and fun to do.

CEAM: Department of Visual Arts Faculty Exhibit
Experience the talents of Flagler College's visual arts faculty.
Monday-Saturday, Sep. 5 - Nov. 8, 2025 | Times Vary
CEAM: Department of Visual Arts Faculty Exhibit
48 Sevilla St.
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
The
Crisp-Ellert Art Museum
(CEAM) and
Flagler College
present the Department of Visual Art Faculty Exhibition from September 5 to November 8, 2025. View the artwork Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and on Saturdays from 12:00 to 4:00 p.m.
This special exhibit showcases the recent works of the full- and part-time fine art and graphic design faculty. The opening reception, which is free and open to the public, is on Friday, September 5, from 5:00 to 8:00 p.m. as part of the
First Friday Art Walk
. At 6:00 p.m., several of the featured artists lead an informal walk through of the exhibition.
The exhibition features work by artists: Sarah Alexander, Luke Brodersen (and Future Friends), Diana Lodi, Jenna McDonald, Russell Maycumber, Laura Mongiovi, Patrick Moser, Natalie Novak, Sara Pedigo, Bernadette Rivell, Leslie Robison, Jason Schwab, and Chris Smith. The show also introduces new faculty members Samuel Aye-Gboyin, Ida Moraghebati, and Ron Edelen.
On Wednesday, October 29, at 6 p.m., Dr. Stephanie Hohlios, an Assistant Professor of Art History, presents a lecture titled "Art History as Community Engagement." The talk takes place in the Virginia Room of the Ringhaver Student Center at Flagler College, located at 50 Sevilla Street. Dr. Hohlios specializes in modern and contemporary Japanese art, including painting, performance, and community-based projects. Her fieldwork focuses on the former coal mining area of Chikuhō on the island of Kyushu in Japan.
Admission:
Free and open to the public.
When:
The exhibition runs from September 5 to November 8, 2025. The museum's hours are Monday through Friday, 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and Saturday, 12:00 to 4:00 p.m., while classes are in session.
Where:
The Crisp-Ellert Art Museum (CEAM), 74 King Street in
Historic Downtown
.

St. Augustine, FL 32084

Food Festivals & Events
Foodie fun with culinary heritage events and festivals.
St. Augustine is home to local delicacies such as the datil pepper and Minorcan clam chowder. Celebrate this culinary heritage at food festivals and farm-to-table events around town. Enjoy the eats at the annual Great Chowder Debate and the
Lions Seafood Festival
. And don't forget to stay hydrated St. Augustine style via the
Spanish Wine Festival
and the
St. Augustine Brewers' Fest
. Here, food and drink are celebrated daily, so there's always something local to taste.

Yoga in the Garden
The Lightner Museum hosts yoga in the Radzinski Family Garden.
Third Saturdays | 8:30 a.m. - 9:30 a.m.
View Website
Yoga in the Garden
In the Radzinski Family Garden.
75 King Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
Show all
The Lightner Museum hosts Yoga In the Garden on the third Saturday of each month from 8:30 to 9:30 a.m.
This yoga session is suitable for all, and each participant should bring a yoga mat or towel and water. An instructor from
Serenity Yoga
leads the session on the lawn of the Radzinski Family Garden, on the south end of the building. This event recalls the days of Henry Flagler's Alcazar Hotel and its well-known spa facilities.
If the grass is wet, the class will be moved to the sidewalk next to the lawn.
Admission:
This is a donation-based event, and registration is not required.
When:
On the third Saturday of each month, from 8:30 to 9:30 a.m.
Where:
The Radzinski Family Garden is behind the Lightner Museum at 75 King Street, St. Augustine.
NOTE:
Some dates may be rescheduled due to inclement weather.
Yoga in the Garden
In the Radzinski Family Garden.
75 King Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084

Can't-Miss Events
Find the latest and greatest events in the oldest city.
Throughout the year, St. Augustine hosts unforgettable festivals, live music, and cultural celebrations. Whether it’s a nationally recognized music festival, a holiday festivity, or an authentic reenactment, there's always something
BIG
happening in this tiny town. From art exhibits and live theater to historical events and culinary creations, our can't-miss events feature the best of the nation’s oldest city.

Third Space Improv
presents Friday Night Live on First Fridays at 8:00 p.m.
Kick off your weekend with Friday Night Live—an unscripted comedy show that's wild and unpredictable (just like Florida). Improv comedians from all over the First Coast take your suggestions and spin them into silly scenes, crazy characters, and comedy chaos. There are no scripts, no filters, and no apologies—just pure spontaneous comedy from Northeast Florida.
Third Space Improv offers beer, wine, soft drinks, fresh popcorn, and a snack bar.
This show is for audience members 18+.

Improv Night at Colonial Oak Music Park
No two shows are the same since the audience takes the lead at Improv Night.
Wednesdays through 2025 | 7:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.
Improv Night at Colonial Oak Music Park
At the north end of St. George Street.
27 St. George Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
Trained comedy professionals dive headfirst into any challenge the audience throws at them in this unscripted, interactive comedy experience held each Wednesday at Colonial Oak Music Park in Historic Downtown.
Suitable for the whole family, the show is always clean and never mean. Staged by First Coast Comedy, Improv Night features comedians trained by actor and comedian, Alex Grindeland, and veteran improv comedian, David Bogan.
For
more information and to purchase tickets, visit here
.
Admission
: There is no set price, and ticket donations of $10.00 to $25.00 are appreciated. Tickets can be purchased in advance, or on the day of the show, for this general admission seating event.
When:
7:30 to 9:00 p.m. Wednesdays through 2025
Where:
The Colonial Oak Music Park is located at 21 St. George St. in Historic Downtown.

At the north end of St. George Street.
27 St. George Street
St. Augustine, FL 32084

Yoga on the Lawn
The Ximenez-Fatio House hosts yoga in the museum's serene lawn.
Every Wednesday & Sunday | 8:30 a.m. - 9:30 a.m.
View Website
(904) 325-1497
Yoga on the Lawn
(904) 325-1497
In the museum's front lawn.
20 Aviles St.
St. Augustine, FL 32084
View Google Map
Share This
The Ximenez-Fatio House Museum hosts Yoga on the Lawn every Wednesday and Sunday from 8:30 to 9:30 a.m.
This vinyasa flow yoga session is suitable for all levels, and each participant should bring a yoga mat or towel and water. Follow along as an instructor from
Pilates Yoga Loft
leads a class on the front lawn of the Ximenez-Fatio House Museum.
Free parking at the museum can be accessed from Cadiz Street.
Admission:
Pre-registration is required and is $15.00 per person. Sign up on the
Mind Body app
or call (904) 325-1497 for more information on special class passes.
When:
Every Wednesday and Sunday from 8:30 to 9:30 a.m. unless no one registers.
Where:
The Ximenez-Fatio House Museum, 20 Aviles Street, St. Augustine, Florida 32084.
NOTE: Some dates may be cancelled due to inclement weather. Credits will be given to students for future classes—refunds are not offered.

Amphitheatre Farmers Market
Enjoy fresh local produce, handmade arts and crafts, and live entertainment.
Saturdays | 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
Amphitheatre Farmers Market
(904) 315-9252
St. Augustine Amphitheatre
1340C A1A South
St. Augustine, FL 32080
View Google Map
Share This
+2 more
On Saturday mornings, from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., purchase plants, fresh produce, eggs, cheese, prepared foods, and art at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre Farmers Market.
This favorite event for locals and visitors brings a bustling crowd every week as people shop for fresh groceries, gifts, souvenirs, and breakfast or lunch. Vendors line both sides of the corridor between the Amphitheatre front door and the parking lot.
As you near the Front Porch, you'll hear live music from the
Free Rangers
, a jam band with local and visiting amateur and professional musicians. The Free Rangers offer a wide variety of music including bluegrass, folk, and old rock spiced with the occasional original tune. If it's a perfect Saturday morning, take your time shopping, grab food and a drink from one of the vendors, and sit with friends while enjoying the band.
The list of vendors is long, and the foods available include fresh cheese, locally-caught shrimp, guacamole prepared while you wait, and organic produce. Local authors and artists sell their books, greeting cards, jewelry, baby gear, pet gear, soaps, and a whole lot more.
Each Saturday, several food trucks serve their specialties, a few bakeries offer fresh-baked treats as long as supplies last, and the Amphitheatre's bar makes one of the best—and spiciest Bloody Marys.
Admission:
Free
When:
Saturday mornings from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
Where:
St. Augustine Amphitheatre
, 1340 A1A South, St. Augustine, Florida 32080.
Extra parking is available at the Elk's Lodge just south of the Amphitheatre.
For more information, including how to be a vendor,
visit here.
(Scroll down on that page for the vendor form.)

(904) 315-9252
St. Augustine Amphitheatre
1340C A1A South
St. Augustine, FL 32080

Five Star Property Management
Luxury condo management company with beachside rentals and high-end amenities.
Five Star Property Management
(904) 471-9750
6233 A1A South
St. Augustine, FL 32080
View Google Map
Share This
+1 more
Five Star Property Management provides luxury rentals on
St. Augustine's beaches
. The company rents units by day, week, or month, and also has long-term rentals. Five Star Property Management offers only high-end rentals in pristine condition.
Each unit has one to six bedrooms with oceanfront and intercoastal views. All rentals contain bright coastal, modern, or mid-century modern-styled decor with kitchens and kitchenettes with state-of-the-art cookware.
Some amenities at Five Star Property Management rentals may include a jacuzzi, pool, fireplace, washer, dryer, dishwasher, HDTV, wrap-around deck, wet bar, and private balcony. The up-scale amenities, convenient locations, and spacious accommodations make the rental properties at Five Star ideal for large groups or families looking for a luxurious beach getaway.
